Headline: Techpreneur | Incubator | GCC enabler
Comment:
Very well articulated Rishabh Mariwala  Mumbai Spirit is the unique differentiator. 
For any start up it has - 
1. Flow of capital,
2. Clarity in thinking
3. Opportunity to scale through its huge demand 
4. Experience industry leaders willing to guide & help
5. Value of time & pace (do it now, do it fast!) 
6. The healthy competition making you to push your limits
7. Culture allowing to make mistakes & re-bounce
8. Diversity - accommodating anybody & everybody in its ecosystem, nobody is left out
9. Grit, never give up attitude in the air 
and many more..  
Once a Mumbaiyya always a Mumbaiyya and we carry this spirit wherever we go :-)

Headline: ASISA.VC (The VC Academy | Pre-Accelerator) | Venture Capital | Author| The Times of India Group
Comment:
infrastructure is getting better in Mumbai - with that the distances decrease and make it easier to live on lesser spends. This is critical for the startup ecosystem. 

In Gurgaon you can still have an airconditioned 2br condo apartment for 50,000 monthly (30 minutes non-peak and 50 minutes peak hours) from the airport.

Headline: VC | IB | Fundraise | M&A
Comment: well said Rishabh Mariwala Personally, I love Mumbai. Being from Bihar, I found Mumbai to be a city full of passion and ambition. It's my opinion, everyone should experience living here at least once in their youth-Mumbai has so much to teach.
